intro: Aloinella, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asphodelaceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Aloinella capensis and Aloinella monticola. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in panicles. Aloinella is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
